title.narrative: Provision of Monitoring and Evaluation Services Transforming the Economy through Climate smart agribusiness (NU-TEC) project

description.narrative: OPM is providing Monitoring and Evaluation Services for the DFID-funded 'Northern Uganda: Transforming the Economy through Climate Smart Agribusiness' (NU-TEC) project. The project is investing ?48 million over the next 7 years in Northern Uganda. The overall objective of the project is to 'support the North?s transition from an isolated, conflict-affected and economically lagging region with high vulnerability to climate change, into a dynamic wealth creating economy, supplying more and greater value products to Uganda and the surrounding region and with greater resilience to a changing climate'.

The NU-TEC project will identify and support private sector agents of change in market systems relevant to the poor and provide technical and financial support to agribusinesses in Northern Uganda. Even though the project does not aim to directly target smallholders or other groups of beneficiaries to receive project goods and services, the ultimate beneficiaries of the project will still be the smallholder farmers and agricultural labourers in Northern Uganda. NU-TEC intends to raise income, create productive jobs and increase resilience to climate change of poor smallholders by facilitating development of new business models and markets that benefit the poor and by financing medium and long term investments in targeted agricultural markets. The NU-TEC project will operate through three main components including market systems development, medium term credit fund and long term investment and capacity building. All of these components will both individually and collectively contribute to the overall impact of NU-TEC on climate resilience and income of smallholder farmers.
